overview: Lamentations is a collection of five poems mourning Jerusalem's destruction by Babylon. Through tears, it affirms God's faithfulness and calls the people to return to Him.

verses.text: The steadfast love of the LORD never ceases; his mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.
The LORD is good to those who wait for him, to the soul who seeks him. It is good that one should wait quietly for the salvation of the LORD.
Let us test and examine our ways, and return to the LORD!

passages.title: Hope in the Midst of Grief
passages.summary: At the book's center, amid overwhelming grief, the author remembers God's faithfulness and finds hope.

facts.text: The first four chapters are acrostic poems, each verse beginning with successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.
Tradition attributes Lamentations to Jeremiah, who witnessed Jerusalem's fall and prophesied it for decades.
Jews read Lamentations annually on Tisha B'Av, a fast day commemorating the temple's destruction.
The hymn 'Great Is Thy Faithfulness' is based on Lamentations 3:22-23, finding hope in tragedy.
